basics.name: Julian Brown
basics.label: Software Engineer
basics.summary: Highly motivated software engineer with 4 years of experience. Passionate about devops, developer productivity and distributed systems.

work.summary: Infrastructure SME/Lead for the Consulting Team (100+ team members)
highlights: Built responsive, and accessible static landing pages for numerous Fortune 500 companies using ES6 Javascript, and Soy Templates (e.g cafe.haagen-dazs.es.yext-cdn.com)
Decreased CI/CD build times for the Consulting Engineerng monorepo by updating our build system from Make to Bazel.
Designed and implemented a continues integration tool to build and serve pull requests to Consulting Pages using Docker, Nginx, and Jenkins.

Designed and implemented a monitoring system for services and products offered by the Consulting organization using Go, Prometheus, and Alertmanager. Alerts and metrics are then routed to a custom dashboard and team slack channels.
Developed and unit tested file transfer, file manager and filesystem code modules in C for Common Flight Software to allow other programs more quickly develop their own flight software.
Set up a simulation of flight software on a virtual machine allowing for more realistic testing of flight software
Wrote C++ models for different embedded components in the Cygnus spacecraft for SITL and HITL simulation testing

work.summary: Study of perturbations generated by stratified incompressible thermo-hydrodynamics (PI. Dr. Paterson)
highlights: Created and ran CFD simulations of perturbations generated by thermo-hydrodynamic disturbances using OpenFOAM and Python in the Unix environment
Constructed 3D images of flow from 2D images using python and ParaVIEW

Greatly reduced time to create preliminary designs of a rocket motor by developing a GUI rocket motor sizing application (RocketSolver) in C# that also performed preliminary structural and performance calculations.

work.summary: Modeling of a Hall Effect thruster using C++ (FA. Dr. Srinivasan)
highlights: Modeled particles within a Hall Effect thruster using C++ to produce a real time visual simulation charged particles.

work.summary: Created API to store Windows Phone user data using PHP and MySQL
